item.dc:creator: @chris2341 chris2341
item.description:
@chris2341 wrote:

Here is all I have for server settings in all of the .Java files. The one I upload says .no-ip.org where it says 127.0.0.1
What should I change/ can I change anything Port checker says it is open… Friends still cannot connect
private Gui(String args[])
{
super();
try
{

System.out.println(“Attempting to Connect”);
Serverip = “127.0.0.1”;

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Getting A New Server Online
item.dc:creator: @chris2341 chris2341
item.description:
@chris2341 wrote:

I have been using eclipse and Ctrl+F I only have a place to change the IP in GUI.java and do not have EGUI.java the Client.java does not have a place to set and Ip. To put my server online I upload the client with GUI.java having my.no-ip.org and then I run the server on my computer and change the GUI.java to 127.0.0.1 to play. This doesnt allow my friends to connect am I doing anything blatantly wrong? And is there a way to troubleshoot this?

Read full topic
item.source: Help With Getting A New Server Online

item.title: Help With Getting A New Server Online
item.dc:creator: @ImNoHacker ImNoHacker
item.description:
@ImNoHacker wrote:

Are you port fowarding? also Check Client.java on client side. & EGUI.java on client side (if u have it) and change the local ip to your no-ip.

Also a great tip for you would be to first Use Eclipse to code.
Its a coders best friend. Also Try using
Ctrl+f to load the find prompt to quickly check for a line of text in ur code. Instead of reading through it all.

Read full topic
item.source: Help With Getting A New Server Online

item.title: Help With Getting A New Server Online
item.dc:creator: @chris2341 chris2341
item.description:
@chris2341 wrote:

Hello, I am new to coding servers but have some experience coding rs bots in the past(so I am not entirely new at this). I have downloaded a client and source. I have made some minor changes to the look of the loading screen and added some new commands etc. The problem is when I upload the client to mediafire and my friends download it they cannot connect to the server and they get the error. Server is offline. I have done the basic port forwarding with my gateway. I have a no-ip and have put it in the gui.java it looks like this:System.out.println(“Attempting to Connect”);
Serverip = “submissionpkz.no-ip.org”;

and run my personal client looking like this
System.out.println(“Attempting to Connect”);
Serverip = “127.0.0.1”;

I Have heard that in the class.java you are supposed to change the ip but I have read through the entire code/script and cant find it.
Any Help would be greatly appreciated.

Read full topic
item.source: Help With Getting A New Server Online
